passage.title: I am a boxer when I am young
passage.paragraph: An old man cannot sleep every night. One day, he goes to see a doctor. The doctor looks over him carefully and tell him to count from one to ten again and again.
After a few days, the doctor finds the old man even worse than before. The doctor is surprised and asks, "Do you count as I tell you?"
The old man says, "Yes, I do, but every time when I reach eight, I cannot help jumping from bed."
The old man answers, "I am a boxer when I am young."
